title: Old Time looking font, trying to identify
content: Does anyone know a name for this font that looks like an old style of printing, such as for pirate ships?
author: andykropa

comments.content:
Do you have a sample? Or just looking for suggestions?

[Pirate looking typography … arrr matee …](http://web.archive.org/web/20110124001529/http:/www.typophile.com/node/18414)

You could search distributor websites using keywords like [antique](http://web.archive.org/web/20110124001529/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=antique), [antiqued](http://web.archive.org/web/20110124001529/http:/www.myfonts.com/browse/keyword/antiqued/), [rough](http://web.archive.org/web/20110124001529/http:/www.myfonts.com/browse/keyword/rough/), [vintage](http://web.archive.org/web/20110124001529/http:/www.myfonts.com/browse/keyword/vintage/), … depending on what you’re heading for. Ahoy!  
F

Thanks I just re-posted with the image, here and in a new post... I was confused about how to embed the file with the sample.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20110124001529im_/http:/typophile.com/files/apmj08-type_4873.jpg)

Caslon Antique is a heavily used old 'veteran' . There are plenty of less frequently used distressed old typefaces. [Sherwood Types at P22](http://web.archive.org/web/20110124001529/http:/www.p22.com/sherwoodtype/index.html) has a very nice collection of fonts based on old types that might give you a less familiar, but authentic look. You can also search on 'Antique' at sites that allow keyword searches, and find some other ideas.

- Mike Yanega
